humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor as 1.8 x 1.4 x 1.4 cm. According to the rules, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has an invasive Nottingham grade III ductal carcinoma that forms a 1.8 x 1.4 x 1.4 cm mass (AJCC pT2). The T stage is based on the size of the tumor, and in this case, the tumor size is greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, which corresponds to T2.
